info.description:
# ü™ù Get started here

Webhooks are a mechanism that allows services to send real-time notifications to your application regarding asynchronous updates. The collection provides endpoints for setting up and managing webhooks, as well as verifying webhook events.

This collection demonstrates how to interact with a payment gateway and processing API, focusing specifically on the implementation of webhooks.

### üîê Authentication and Authorization

This template assumes the user making requests to the Webhooks API would be authenticated, for example using a Bearer token. You can choose an authentication method to apply to the whole collection by selecting the collection and navigating to the Authorization tab.

## üîñ How to use this collection?

The collection is designed to be flexible and can be customized to meet the specific requirements of your own webhooks API implementation.

#### Step 1: Update the base URL variable

Add your API's base URL in the `baseUrl` collection variable, replacing the existing dummy endpoint (`https://api.example.com`).

#### Step 2: Create a webhook

Start with `Create Webhook` endpoint to create a webhook and enter the following required information:

- `webhook_url`: the name of the webhook that you're creating
- `events`: (optional) Events that you want to trigger this webhook with. should be triggered on all events if none was provided.
    

#### **Step 3: Call the webhook**

Proceed to the `Trigger specific webhook` request. This call will utilize the `webhook_id` e.g. `W123456` set in the previous step. Under the **Body** tab, you can optionally update the payload to send.

#### **Step 4: Verify various webhook payloads**

Try sending several payloads to your webhooks with `Verify webhook` endpoint, and monitor your webhook server logs to verify if your webhooks are configured correctly as expected.

You can see an example of how to configure your webhook to be event-driven. We took Payment Gateway Service as an example here.

#### **Step 5: Continue building the collection**

Create requests in this collection to test the new API endpoints you develop, and integrate your newly created webhooks in your other services.

Retrieve statistics for the events that triggered the webhook.

Creates a new webhook to receive real-time notifications for payment, transaction, and refund events.

Whenever any of these events occur, the defined webhook `webhook_url` endpoint e.g. `https://api.example.com/webhooks/listener-for-payment-gateway` will receive a POST request with relevant data.

Also, you can configure your webhooks to be event-driven by default, as it will only be triggered when one of these system events is fired.
